    | Forecasting                                                                                                                                         | As a Product Owner, I want the Forecasting system to automatically fetch job data from the Towne Park data warehouse every four hours, so that the system displays current and accurate job and wage information<br>Data Integration Requirements<br>System fetches job & cost data from databases every 4 hours<br>Data refresh occurs automatically without manual intervention<br>System maintains both current and historical wage rate data<br>Failed sync attempts are logged and retried with appropriate backoff strategy<br>Data integrity and quality are validated before committing to local database<br>Data Source:<br>Average Hourly Cost:   FROM [TP_LEGION].[dbo].[vwPAYROLL_SUMMARY]<br>Query for Average Hourly Cost (last 14 days):<br>Step 1:<br>SELECT <br>    [WORK_LOCATION],<br>    [TITLE],<br>    SUM([TOTAL_DOLLARS]) AS TotalDollars,<br>    SUM(CASE <br>        WHEN [PAY_TYPE] NOT IN ('DIFFERENTIAL', 'MEAL PREMIUM') THEN [TOTAL_HOURS]<br>        ELSE 0<br>    END) AS TotalHoursExcludingSpecialTypes,<br>    CASE <br>        WHEN SUM(CASE <br>            WHEN [PAY_TYPE] NOT IN ('DIFFERENTIAL', 'MEAL PREMIUM') THEN [TOTAL_HOURS]<br>            ELSE 0<br>        END) > 0 <br>        THEN SUM([TOTAL_DOLLARS]) / SUM(CASE <br>            WHEN [PAY_TYPE] NOT IN ('DIFFERENTIAL', 'MEAL PREMIUM') THEN [TOTAL_HOURS]<br>            ELSE 0<br>        END)<br>        ELSE 0<br>    END AS AverageHourlyRate<br>FROM [TP_LEGION].[dbo].[vwPAYROLL_SUMMARY]<br>WHERE [WORK_LOCATION] IS NOT NULL <br>  AND [WORK_LOCATION] <> ''<br>  AND [TITLE] IS NOT NULL<br>  AND [TITLE] <> ''<br>  AND [DATE] >= DATEADD(day, -14, 2:<br>The results from Step 1 should be filtered against the list of Customer Sites in the platform.  There is no need to store Job or Wage information about non-added Sites.<br> | Business Rules and Data Quality Requirements <br>Core Data Quality Requirements (Across All Queries)<br>1. No Missing or Empty Values<br>   - Location identifiers (LOCATION_SITE, WORK_LOCATION, CostCenterCode) must not be NULL or empty strings<br>   - Job identifiers (JOB, TITLE, JobProfileCode) must not be NULL or empty strings<br>   - Results with NULL calculated values are excluded<br>2. Uniqueness Controls<br>   - All employee counts use COUNT(DISTINCT) to prevent duplicate counting<br>   - Results are grouped by appropriate dimensions to ensure accurate aggregation<br>3. Standardized Output Format<br>   - Results are consistently ordered by location and job-related fields<br>   - Job codes are standardized (extracted from longer descriptive fields)<br>Query-Specific Business Rules<br>Average Hourly Rate Calculation<br>1. Recency Rule<br>   - Only data from the last 14 days is used for calculations<br>   - Ensures rates reflect current compensation patterns<br>2. Pay Type Exclusions<br>   - Differential and meal premium pay types are excluded from hours calculations<br>   - All dollars are included regardless of pay type<br>3. Rate Calculation Method<br>   - Average hourly rate = Total dollars ÷ Total hours (excluding special pay types)<br>   - Division by zero protection is implemented<br>Sync Frequency Rules<br>Primary Schedule: Every 4 hours starting at 00:00 UTC<br>Retry Logic: Failed syncs retry upon the next sync trigger<br>Failed Sync Notification: Failed syncs will notify the Towne Park Billing team group in Azure DevOps<br>Overlap Prevention: New sync cannot start if previous sync is still running<br>Non-Functional Requirements<br>Performance Requirements<br>Sync Duration: Complete sync must finish within 30 minutes for up to 50,000 wage records<br>Database Impact: Sync operations should not block normal application queries for more than 5 seconds<br>Memory Usage: Sync process should not exceed 2GB RAM usage<br>Network Timeout: Database connections timeout after 300 seconds<br> |
| 2137                                                                                                                                                                                                       | Forecasting                                                                                                                                         | As an Admin, I want to manage Job Codes and Job Groups through a comprehensive interface, so that I can organize job codes into logical groups and ensure proper site assignments are automatically derived<br>Detailed Description<br>The Admin UI for Job Group Management provides a centralized interface for organizing job codes received from Workday integration into logical job groups. This system automatically calculates site assignments based on job code usage patterns, eliminating the need for manual site configuration. The interface handles the complete lifecycle of job codes from initial import through group assignment, title editing, and deactivation.<br>The system addresses the challenge that neither Legion nor Workday have the concept of Job Groups, requiring the admin to create this organizational structure within the forecasting system. Job codes are imported with their site usage data, and the admin must assign meaningful titles and group them appropriately for forecasting purposes.<br>Step-by-Step User Flow<br>Primary Flow: Managing Job Codes and Groups<br>Access the Interface<br>Navigate to Admin Panel → Job Group Management<br>View the main dashboard with Job Codes and Job Groups sections<br>Review New Job Codes<br>Filter job codes to view ""New Codes"" (unassigned codes with titles matching their codes)<br>Identify codes that need attention (marked with blue ""New"" badges)<br>Edit Job Code Titles<br>Click the edit (pencil) icon on a job code<br>Update the title from the default code value to a descriptive name<br>Save the changes<br>Create Job Groups<br>Click ""Create Group"" button<br>Enter a descriptive group name<br>Save the new group<br>Assign Job Codes to Groups<br>Select multiple job codes using checkboxes<br>Choose a target group from the dropdown<br>Click ""Assign"" to bulk assign codes to the group<br>OR use the move icon to move individual codes<br>Monitor Site Assignments<br>Review the ""Calculated Site Assignments"" section<br>Verify that sites automatically receive appropriate job groups based on job code usage<br>Manage Group Lifecycle<br>Deactivate job codes when no longer needed<br>Deactivate job groups when all contained codes are deactivated<br>Business Rules<br>Job Code Rules<br>New Job Code Definition: A job code is considered ""new"" if it has not been assigned to a group AND its title matches its code exactly<br>Active Code Restrictions: Only active job codes can be moved to active groups, or bulk assigned<br>Inactive Code Flexibility: Inactive job codes can be moved to any group (active or inactive)<br>Title Uniqueness: Job code titles should be distinct from the code itself (unless New)<br>Site Usage Immutable: Job code site assignments come from Workday and cannot be manually modified<br>Job Group Rules<br>Group Deactivation Prerequisite: Job groups can only be deactivated when ALL job codes within them are deactivated<br>Active Group Assignment: Active job codes can only be assigned to active job groups<br>Empty Group Handling: Empty job groups are allowed and marked with ""Empty"" badge<br>Group Name Uniqueness: Job group names must be unique within the system<br>Site Assignment Rules<br>Automatic Calculation: Site job group assignments are automatically derived from job code assignments<br>Near Real-time Updates: Site assignments update immediately when job codes are moved between groups<br>No Manual Override: Site assignments cannot be manually configured - they are purely calculated<br>System Integration Rules<br>Data Sync: New job codes are imported from Legion database Workday view with their site usage data<br>Data Integrity: Job code identifiers cannot be modified (only titles can be changed)<br>                                   | AC1: Job Code Title Editing<br>Given I am viewing the Job Codes list<br>When I click the edit icon on an active job code<br>Then I should see a dialog with the current job code and title<br>And I should be able to modify the title field<br>And the job code field should be disabled and uneditable<br>Given I am editing a job code title<br>When I enter a new title and click ""Save Changes" | 2178                                                                                                                                                                                                       | Billing                                                                                                                                             | As a Billing Admin, I want to validate account numbers against the GP master table before processing unit accounts batches, so that I can identify and resolve invalid accounts upfront, preventing batch failures and reducing processing time<br>Detailed Description<br>Currently, the Unit Accounts Batch process retrieves ~10,000 rows of site statistics from the data warehouse and sends them to Great Plains (GP) in 1,000-row batches via SOAP endpoint. When invalid or inactive account numbers are encountered, the entire 1,000-row batch fails, requiring admins to manually identify and fix issues one at a time through multiple processing attempts.<br>This enhancement introduces a pre-validation step that cross-references all account numbers against a GP account view (GL_ACCOUNTS) before any data is sent to GP. Invalid accounts are identified upfront, displayed in a user-friendly interface with export capabilities, and must be resolved before processing can proceed.<br>Source for cross-referencing:<br>SELECT [ACCOUNT_NUMBER]<br>    ,[STATUS]<br>    ,[DB_SOURCE]<br>  FROM [TP_EDW].[dbo].[vwGL_ACCOUNTS]<br>  WHERE [DB_SOURCE] = 'Towne'<br>Example results: See attached xlsx file<br>Step-by-Step User Flow<br>Primary Flow: Successful Validation and Processing<br>Admin navigates to Admin Panel → Unit Accounts Batch tab<br>Admin selects billing cycle (month/year) from dropdown menus<br>Admin clicks ""Validate Accounts"" button<br>System displays validation progress indicator<br>System shows validation results with summary statistics<br>If all accounts are valid:<br>Green success alert displays ""Validation Successful"
